events.originalText: The British government announced that it had removed the last land mine from the Falkland Islands, laid by Argentine forces during the 1982 Falklands War.
events.subtitle: Land mines in the Falkland Islands
events.headline: British government removes last land mine from Falkland Islands

events.originalText: Ships of the South Korean and North Korean navies skirmished off Daecheong Island in the Yellow Sea.
events.subtitle: Daecheong incident
events.headline: South Korean and North Korean navies skirmish off Daecheong Island

events.originalText: At the Ibero-American Summit in Santiago, Chile, King Juan Carlos I of Spain asked Venezuelan president Hugo Chávez "Why don't you shut up?" after Chávez repeatedly interrupted a speech by Spanish prime minister José Luis Rodríguez Zapatero.
events.subtitle: Ibero-American Summit
events.headline: King Juan Carlos I of Spain confronts Venezuelan president at Ibero-American Summit

events.originalText: Prominent Sri Lankan Tamil politician and human rights lawyer Nadarajah Raviraj was assassinated in Colombo.
events.subtitle: Sri Lankan Tamils
events.headline: Sri Lankan Tamil politician Nadarajah Raviraj assassinated in Colombo

events.originalText: Writer and environmental activist Ken Saro-Wiwa and eight others from the Movement for the Survival of the Ogoni People were executed by the Nigerian military government.
events.subtitle: Ken Saro-Wiwa
events.headline: Writer Ken Saro-Wiwa and others executed by Nigerian military government

events.originalText: SS Edmund Fitzgerald (pictured) sank in Lake Superior with the loss of 29 lives.
events.subtitle: SS Edmund Fitzgerald
events.headline: SS Edmund Fitzgerald sinks in Lake Superior, 29 lives lost

events.originalText: Three men hijacked Southern Airways Flight 49 and threatened to crash it into Oak Ridge National Laboratory in the U.S. state of Tennessee.
events.subtitle: Southern Airways Flight 49
events.headline: Hijackers threaten to crash Southern Airways Flight 49 into Oak Ridge National Laboratory

events.originalText: The children's television series Sesame Street premiered in the United States.
events.subtitle: Sesame Street
events.headline: Sesame Street premieres in the United States

events.originalText: Indonesian National Revolution: Following the killing of Brigadier A. W. S. Mallaby on 30 October, British forces retaliated by attacking Surabaya.
events.subtitle: Indonesian National Revolution
events.headline: British forces retaliate after killing of Brigadier A. W. S. Mallaby in Surabaya

events.originalText: An earthquake registering 7.7 Mw struck the Vrancea region of Romania.
events.subtitle: 1940 Vrancea earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake strikes Vrancea region of Romania

events.originalText: Brazilian president Getúlio Vargas led a coup against his own constitutional government, establishing the dictatorial Estado Novo regime.
events.subtitle: Getúlio Vargas
events.headline: Brazilian president Getúlio Vargas leads coup, establishes Estado Novo regime

events.originalText: Journalist and explorer Henry Morton Stanley (pictured) located missing missionary and explorer David Livingstone near Lake Tanganyika in present-day Tanzania.
events.subtitle: Henry Morton Stanley
events.headline: Henry Morton Stanley locates missing explorer David Livingstone near Lake Tanganyika

events.originalText: Henry Wirz, the Confederate superintendent of Andersonville Prison, was hanged after a controversial conviction, becoming the only American Civil War officer executed for war crimes.
events.subtitle: Henry Wirz
events.headline: Confederate superintendent of Andersonville Prison hanged for war crimes

events.originalText: At the culmination of a Swedish civil war, supporters of the deposed Sigismund III Vasa were publicly executed in what came to be known as the Åbo Bloodbath.
events.subtitle: Sigismund III Vasa
events.headline: Supporters of deposed Sigismund III Vasa executed in Åbo Bloodbath

events.originalText: Fourth Crusade: The Siege of Zara (present-day Zadar, Croatia), the first attack on a Catholic city by Catholic crusaders, began.
events.subtitle: Fourth Crusade
events.headline: Fourth Crusade begins Siege of Zara in present-day Zadar, Croatia
